column1: You had shoulder replacement surgery to replace the bones of your shoulder joint with artificial joint parts.
You will need to wear a sling for the first 6 weeks after surgery.
Ask your doctor about which sports and other activities are ok for you after you recover.
Your doctor will give you a prescription for pain medicines.
Narcotic pain medicine (codeine, hydrocodone, and oxycodone) can make you constipated.
Taking ibuprofen (Advil, Motrin) or other anti-inflammatory medicines with your prescription pain medicine may also help.
Your doctor may also give you aspirin to prevent blood clots.
Keep the dressing (bandage) over your wound clean and dry.
